#taxgroup Reptiles species Western Skink / Eumeces skiltonianus
#
# Rank
1
# Nestsite
-99
# Foraging Habitat
-99
# Forage/Prey Availability
-99
# Predator Avoidance
-99
# Refugia/Shelter
-99
# Literature
Distribution
south-central British Columbia through Washington, Oregon, and Idaho to western Utah, Nevada, and southern California into Baja California
General Habitat
grassy slopes in oak woodlands and in less damp coniferous forests; pine and juniper forests, rocky canyons, rimrock areas
Home or Activity Range
no information available
Specific Habitat Preferences
found within or under the bark of decaying logs or under surface debris or rocks, in treeless areas, found in loose rock accumulations
Nestsite Characteristics
lay eggs in flask-shapped burrows under rocks or logs
Foraging Habitat Characteristics
ground-forage in grass or leaves
Diet
small invertebrates
Predators
no information available
Shelter Habitats
found within or under the bark of decaying logs or under surface debris or rocks
Response to Disturbance
no information available
General Sources of Background Information
Storm and Leonard 1995
Summaries of Specific Studies
no information available
